revised_title: Case Study: Successful Amputation in a Woman with Gangrene
tldr: A case study of a 62-year-old woman who lost her leg and part of her thigh due to gangrene. Despite her age and the severity of the condition, the woman survived after the affected limb was amputated. The case highlights the importance of timely medical intervention and the effectiveness of amputation in treating severe cases of gangrene.
